explanation: pleasant; friendly and easy to like
sentence: So amiable was the mood of the meeting that a decision was soon reached.
sentence_gap: So _______ was the mood of the meeting that a decision was soon reached.

explanation: a small pointed tool used for making holes, especially in leather
sentence: Some of the bones have been modified into tools such as awls and points.
sentence_gap: Some of the bones have been modified into tools such as ____ and points.

explanation: a serious mistake, usually caused by not taking care or thinking
sentence: He said that the tax was a major political blunder.
sentence_gap: He said that the tax was a major political _______.

explanation: a disease in which an area of someone's eye becomes less clear so that they cannot see clearly, or the area affected in this way
sentence: He cannot even be treated for cataracts because of feared internal head injuries.
sentence_gap: He cannot even be treated for _________ because of feared internal head injuries.

explanation: an area controlled by a bishop
sentence: The king wanted to know the exact number of recusants in each diocese.
sentence_gap: The king wanted to know the exact number of recusants in each _______.

explanation: formal; to criticize someone or something in a way that shows you do not respect or value him, her, or it
sentence: The actor's work for charity has recently been disparaged in the press as an attempt to get publicity.
sentence_gap: The actor's work for charity has recently been __________ in the press as an attempt to get publicity.

explanation: to change the shape of something so that it looks strange or unnatural
sentence: The map distorted Greenland to appear four times its actual size.
sentence_gap: The map _________ Greenland to appear four times its actual size.

explanation: a low continuous noise that does not change its note
sentence: Outside the tent I could hear the constant drone of insects.
sentence_gap: Outside the tent I could hear the constant _____ of insects.

explanation: (especially in sports) a movement that is intended to make your opponent think you are going to do one thing when you are really going to do something else
sentence: He produced a brilliant feint, passed two defenders, and smashed the ball into the net.
sentence_gap: He produced a brilliant _____, passed two defenders, and smashed the ball into the net.

explanation: formal; officially having the named position
sentence: The incumbent president faces problems which began many years before he took office.
sentence_gap: The _________ president faces problems which began many years before he took office.

explanation: the central part of an atom, usually made up of protons and neutrons; the part of a cell that controls its growth
sentence: DNA is stored in the nucleus of a cell.
sentence_gap: DNA is stored in the _______ of a cell.

explanation: a small lump of a valuable metal or mineral, especially gold, that is found in the earth
sentence: With gold sitting just under the surface, the shallowness allowed diggers to easily unearth gold nuggets.
sentence_gap: With gold sitting just under the surface, the shallowness allowed diggers to easily unearth gold _______.

sentence: They believe that while his remains are in unconsecrated ground he will remain in purgatory.
sentence_gap: They believe that while his remains are in unconsecrated ground he will remain in _________.

explanation: to say something again so that people take notice of it
sentence: I must reiterate that we have no intention of signing this contract.
sentence_gap: I must _________ that we have no intention of signing this contract.
